page.title: 10MELSONBY-TheWm.CockinCharity
page.content: Shortly before his death in{1760 Wm. {Cockin of Melsonby} set up a{trust}by giving land in the form of a {12\ acre {field }known as {'Woodhill'} to this parish. This land was to be rented to the highest bidder and the{income from {rent}was to be {used to educate 6 poor {children}of the parish. Thus began the first recorded school in the village. Some time later, a{second field,}now referred to by its Ordnance Survey number {0.S.21} and sited on Gatherley Moor was added. This trust was reorganised in 1905 and again in {1978,}when it became an {officially registered charity} under the title of {Wm. Cockin's Educational {Foundation.} Money from this fund is given by the trustees for such things as:- swimming lessons & transport, sports & micro- computer equipment used in school etc.
